context: St. Barthélemy has a small airport known as <a0_0>Gustaf III<a0_0/> Airport on <a1_0>the <b5_0>north coast<b5_0/><a1_0/> of the island that is served by <b6_0>small regional commercial aircraft and <a4_0>charters<b6_0/><a4_0/>. The nearest airport with a runway length sufficient to land a typical commercial jet airliner is on the neighboring island of <a3_0>Sint Maarten<a3_0/>: <a2_0>Princess Juliana International Airport<a2_0/>, which acts as a hub, providing connecting flights with regional carriers to St. Barthélemy. <b8_0><b9_0>Several<b9_0/><b8_0/> international airlines and <b7_0>domestic Caribbean<b7_0/> airlines operate in this sector.
